intro: Psychotria interior, commonly known as the interior psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Psychotria interior is often found in understory habitats of tropical forests, where it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native ecosystem.
